name: healthily
content:
healthily adverb
(HEALTH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows a person or living thing is strong and well: Some people are naturally and healthily thin. The trees are able to grow normally and healthily.
in a way that is good for the health of a person or living thing: Eat healthily and take plenty of exercise. Almonds are delicious on their own, roasted or, less healthily, sugared.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are some things that children need to grow healthily.She is plump, but healthily so, and fit.He has achieved a lot in his campaign to get us to feed children healthily.They avoid alcohol and live healthily.Try to lose weight healthily, by exercising more and eating better foods, rather than by extreme dieting.The air has space to circulate healthily around the plant's roots.

healthily adverb
(REASONABLY)
in a way that shows reasonable feelings or good judgment: He is loyal to his party, but healthily cynical about politicians. It can be hard to judge one's own actions healthily.
More examplesFewer examplesLike all artists, he was healthily egotistical.Young people may need help to healthily manage relationships.Too often, we treat playground boisterousness as deviant rather than healthily normal.
